intro: Centropogon argutus, commonly known as the sharpleaf piper. It is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. The plant is characterized by its narrow, pointed leaves and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments, often near water bodies. Centropogon argutus is part of the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants.
